title: Man accused of threatening Biden shot and killed in FBI raid in Utah
description: A Utah man who was accused of making threats to President Biden was shot and killed in an FBI raid. The man also threatened New York prosecutor Alvin Bragg.

title: There has been an 80% drop in cases of unruly airline passengers since 2021
description: The Federal Aviation Administration partnered with the FBI in 2021 to bring criminal charges more aggressively against disorderly airline passengers.

title: Amid a water crisis, Arizona is using lots of it to grow alfalfa to export overseas
description: NPR's Juana Summers talks with Reveal reporter Nathan Halverson about Arizona's investment in a major land deal that effectively ships the state's limited water supply overseas in the form of hay.

title: Robbie Robertson, guitarist for The Band and Bob Dylan, has died at 80
description: The Rock and Roll Hall of Famer helped write the blueprint for Americana music, with songwriting credits including "The Weight" and "Up on Cripple Creek."

title: Biden orders restrictions on U.S. investments in Chinese technology
description: The executive order covers advanced computer chips, micro electronics, quantum information technologies and artificial intelligence. Officials cited national security, rather than economic interests.

title: The settlers brought the lottery to America. It's had a long, uneven history
description: Americans spend an estimated $100 billion each year on lottery tickets. It's a tradition that dates back to the nation's earliest settlers, and was even one the Founding Fathers took part in.

title: Special counsel Jack Smith got a secret search warrant for Trump's Twitter account
description: In January, prosecutors got a search warrant directing Twitter to produce data and records related to the @realDonaldTrump account. The company was ordered not to tell Trump about this.

title: New car prices are cooling, but experts say you still might want to wait to buy
description: The average transaction price for a new car in July was $48,334, a slight dip from June and only a 0.4% year-over-year increase, according to Kelley Blue Book.

title: Meet the last 8 teams in the running for the Women's World Cup
description: The quarterfinalists include Japan, Colombia and Australia, and five European squads. Here are the stars to watch and the key storylines to follow in the quarterfinal matches that begin Thursday.

title: At 84, he has completed his goal of riding all 21,000 miles of the Amtrak network
description: Nat Read says he has ridden every mile on the Amtrak rail network, and he's never grown tired of looking at the country through a train window.

title: The toughest plastic bag ban is failing: A tale of smugglers, dumps and dying goats
description: Kenya was hailed for its decision to outlaw single use plastic bags in 2016, with remarkably hefty penalties. So why are the bags back in stores, piling up in dumps — and being ingested by livestock?

title: An American nurse and her young daughter are freed in Haiti after being held 2 weeks
description: Armed men had seized Alix Dorsainvil and her child from the El Roi Haiti clinic she worked at in a gang-controled part of  Port-au-Prince.

title: Up First briefing: 3 charged in Montgomery brawl; David Hogg's young leaders PAC
description: Three men are charged with assault after a riverfront brawl in Montgomery, Ala. And, Parkland shooting survivor David Hogg starts a PAC to support young Democratic leaders.

title: 'We're not just voting. We're also running.' David Hogg launches young candidate PAC
description: Young voters are growing as a dominant portion of the electorate. At the same time, more are becoming eligible to launch their own bids for office. Now, a new PAC wants to help them run — and win.

title: How one Afghan family made the perilous journey across the U.S.-Mexico border
description: Kabul fell to the Taliban close to two years ago, but desperate Afghans continue to flee, even taking the dangerous route into the U.S. across the Mexican border. Here's the story of one such family.

title: A boy on the autism spectrum struggled with a haircut. His barber saved the day
description: Getting haircuts was one of Jackson's biggest fears. But one barber's patience and creativity made the ordeal something he now looks forward to.

title: A former Fox executive now argues Murdoch is unfit to own TV stations
description: Preston Padden helped Rupert Murdoch launch the Fox broadcast network in the 1990s. Now he argues Murdoch has proved unfit to hold the license for a Philadelphia station.

title: When a brain injury impairs memory, a pulse of electricity may help
description: A severe traumatic brain injury can make it hard to remember recent events or conversations. But a form of brain stimulation appears to ease this memory deficit.

title: How a trial in Texas changed the story of abortion rights in America
description: Wrenching testimony from women denied abortion care turned the focus toward the suffering and health risks faced by mothers.

title: Who is sneaking fentanyl across the southern border? Hint: it's not the migrants
description: We know that illicit fentanyl is flowing into the U.S. from Mexico. Yet we rarely hear from the couriers who smuggle most of it through legal ports of entry. This is one of their stories.

title: Wildfires across Hawaii burn homes, spurring evacuations and an emergency declaration
description: The National Weather Service said Hurricane Dora, passing to the south of the island chain, was partly to blame for gusts that knocked out power, rattled homes and grounded firefighting helicopters.

title: The winning $1.58 billion Mega Millions ticket is sold in Florida
description: Someone in Florida won a $1.58 billion Mega Millions jackpot Tuesday night, ending a stretch of lottery futility that had stretched for nearly four months.

title: Ohio voters reject measure that would have made it harder to change constitution
description: Ohio votes down Issue 1, rejecting conservative lawmakers' attempt to change the constitutional amendment process ahead of a vote on reproductive rights this November.
